name: Hilton Garden Inn Danbury

reviews.title: Clean, friendly, quiet hotel
reviews.text: We stayed for one night on our way from Boston to Delaware. We liked the cookies upon check-in. It was close to many restaurants. We had asked for a room facing away from the highway, and that request was honored. From our third floor window we could see woods and a train tracks, but we did not hear any trains. The room was quiet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. We have stayed here each time we travel to Danbury, usually once a year. We have NEVER been disappointed. The hotel is clean and kept in really nice condition. The room is totally comfortable. We had a room with a king bed, fridge and microwave. Had dinner one night in the restuarant and it was very good, prices were very average. I unknowingly dropped 5.00 on the floor when I went to ask the front desk girl a question. 20 minutes later, she called our room and told me she had found 5.00 and she knew it had to belong to me - WOW!! Who could ask for more than that type of honesty!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Clean - Honest Employee's

reviews.text: Great hotel to stay in. I would recomme=end this place to anyone and they have free cookies every night too :)
reviews.title: Great stay, business or pleasure
Business travel
reviews.text: The team at this hotel makes it a great value for business travelers or those seeking a pleasant, clean, good value a short distance from NYC and CT area attractions. Easy access off the highway, comfortable rooms, spotless on every occasion I have stayed there and a breakfast buffet that offers many choices, plus cook to order options. You are greeted by an attentive, accommodating staff and that attitude continues throughout your stay. Free wifi, beds are adjustable for firmness(excellent comfort) ..great pillows too! Good restaurants nearby in either direction on rt 202. Try the panda garden(5 mins) or Rraci's-Italian(10 mins away towards Brewster.

Stayed at the HGI-Danbury for one night for business. Nice property, close to the highway. Knowing that, I requested a room on the back side, due to being less noisy. I think the even numbered rooms are on the back side of the hotel. Decent room, and free wifi. Breakfast buffet in the morning was an added plus (had free coupon). It's free but don't forget to tip the server/attendant! Business center to print boarding pass was good. 2 free bottles of water as a Hilton Honors member was nice.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: SensiBle choice off I84 - great breakfast. Nice lobby with basic bar. Home feel
reviews.title: Excellent. For price worthwhile

reviews.text: To it. Small swimming pool and a few treadmills for gym. Short drive to Danbury. Local restaurants are reasonable and easy to drive to
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and very Clean

reviews.text: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay. It was a great place to stay but the air conditioning was very noisy in room and you could hear a little noise from the interstate. For the price it was well worth the money.
reviews.title: Good value and great bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first time staying here, and I prefer it to the Springhill Suites where I stayed on my 2 previous business trips. The room was very nice, with a great bed. The breakfast was excellent. Wifi bandwidth was adequate. My only complaint was that the HVAC system was extremely noisy. Even when I turned off the AC, the sound of the fan went away, but there was still a continual noise. Maybe it was coming from the AC in the room next door? There was a large compressor of some sort right outside my room; maybe it was that.
reviews.title: Thank Heavens for Hilton

reviews.text: Also, the workout room was very tiny, but that seems to be the standard in hotels of this level.
reviews.title: Another very good Hilton Garden Inn!

reviews.text: Since I have family in Danbury, my wife, boys and I stay at this hotel when we visit. We've tried other motels in Danbury, but this one is tops for price and location.
reviews.title: Another good stay with the family

reviews.text: Since the motel is right off the exit of Interstate 84, it is convenient. In addition, with a nearby Starbucks, Trader Joe's and a drug store, i.e., all within walking distance, we can get whatever we need.
reviews.title: Nice for business travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for food, there are nearby restaurants like Rosy Tomorrows (nice Sunday brunch) and Chuck's Steak House (my wife's favorite steak restaurant). For a quick breakfast, the Windmill Diner is right down the road.
reviews.title: No issues at all

reviews.text: If you are looking for a quick round of golf, Richter Park is an excellent public course only five minutes from the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the hotel staff, they and are always pleasant and accommodating. The check-in process is quick and our young boys enjoy the free cookies after the ride to Danbury from MetroWest Boston.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant One Night Stay

reviews.text: i chose this hotel the first time because it was the closest to my work, but continued to come back because it had everything i needed. It is very easy to find from the interstate, yet quiet. First impressions are clean, light and airy. There is a small restaurant as well as room service and the food is pretty good. Also, laundry machines, pool and fitness. A 3 minute walk along a side walk will get you to a small shopping center that has everything you might want if you are there for several days.
reviews.title: stayed here several times

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was here for two nights, during a friend's wedding weekend. Great location, right off 84. Used HH points for the stay, so the price was right.
reviews.title: Great service, room and location!

reviews.text: The room was excellent, very clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: "Nice and easy to find hotel"

reviews.text: Service was very good too, I believe it was Christian at the front desk who checked me in and provided some recommendations for restaurants - she was great.
reviews.title: Great location. Friendly front desk. Lousy housekeeping.

reviews.text: The business center, while small, was convenient. Computers were quick.
reviews.title: Just what we needed in a roadside oasis.
